Name: lath, hardwood, raw, kiln drying to u=20% | sawnwood, lath, hardwood, raw, dried (u=20%) | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13378/documentation

This dataset represents the service of kiln drying of one m3 sawn hardwood lath. The wood chip used in the process is considered to be supplied internally which are generated from slabs and sidings when sawing. Characteristics of the of wood chips to be burned: Dry wood density 640 kg/m3; the low heating value 4208 MJ/m3, humidity when burned is estimated to be around 50%, which is achieved after some weeks of drying in the storage. Wood chips will be able to supply the entire thermal demand for drying, Air emission factors as well as the boiler efficiency represent average annual operation including start and stop (warm-up and shut-down). The boiler used is considered to be 300 kW and emission profile refers to the facility. Shrinkage ratio of between the moisture content of u=30% - 0% is 0.004 %/%.;The data was provided by and approved by the Swiss forest industry.;Within ecoinvent, three products - boards, beams and laths - are distinguished:

Kiln drying process starting from sawn hardwood, at the sawmill site, assumed to lose some water before the start of the kiln drying process.

This activity ends with kiln dried hardwood lath, at sawmill. The dataset includes kiln drying of wet wood assumed as u=50% down to u=20%, and shrinkage. The dataset does not include air emissions released from the wood, as the emissions are assume to be comparable to emissions from natural drying during decomposition/rotting.
